title: Disappointing release, Thunderbird Team
content:
Thunderbird Team,

The 115.3.1 release is a real disappointment.

1) I have three accounts in Thunderbird. The subfolders for my three accounts now make no sense. Inbox - has my three accounts, as expected. Drafts - has my three accounts, as expected. Sent - has my three accounts, as expected. Trash - folder now empty. Used to have my three accounts. Now they are under each account's folder Junk - has only two of my three accounts. The third junk folder is labeled 'spam' and is under my Gmail account.

2) When I got a couple of messages just now, they were duplicated (only in Thunderbird, not on any other of my clients). Deleting one of the duplicates wound up deleting both of them and replacing them with a null message dated January 1, 1970. I moved the deleted message from the Trash folder back to the Inbox, resulting in the correct single message.

3) My 2020 Archive folder is no longer under Archives > Local Folders. It is now under the Local Folders account. All the other Archive folders are where they used to be.

4) When I switch to Inbox - sometimes it scrolls to the top, not to where I was, and not to bottom where the most recent messages are. I cannot figure out how to reproduce this.

5) The default density for viewing emails does not correspond to what I used to have. It is unfortunate to not keep the previous default.

I don't dare reverting to the prior release because I have no confidence that doing so will restore my folder configuration. I fear I might even lose data. I know you worked hard on this release, but this user is not happy with the folder bugs and user interface changes.

Tim
creator: tim263

title: New Version of TBird no longer fetches mail
content:
HI, I just updated to Supernova 115.3.1. T-Bird no longer downloads any mail from any of my accounts. It acts like it's going to, but nothing happens.

How can I fix this, or how can I downgrade to the last version?

Thank you,

James
creator: jscohen

title: "Neues" Thunderbird
content:
Ich benutze Thunderbird schon seit Jahren, aber das letzte Update ist so Benutzerunfreundlich das ich den Wunsch habe ein anderes Programm zu nutzen!!!!!! Was nützen mir hundert verschiedene Möglichkeiten Menüleisten zu wählen, wenn das WICHTIGSTE – das Emailfeld zum lesen wird in der größe derart beschnitten wird das man nur noch hin und her scrollen muss???? Das Feld für "erhaltene mails" läßt sich nicht mehr weit genug reduzieren!! Auf diese Art wird dann ungefähr ein Drittel des Bildschirms mit unnötigen Menüleisten und einer nicht mehr einstellbaren mail Vorschau verschwendet!!! In meinen Augen kein Fortschritt, sondern eher ein Rückschritt!!!!!!!!!!! Macht was, oder ihr habt mich als nutzer verloren. Oder gibt es „versteckte" Einstellungen die diesen schwachsinn neutralisieren??

I've been using Thunderbird for years, but the latest update is so user-unfriendly that I have the desire to use another program!!!!!! What good are a hundred different ways to choose menu bars if the MOST IMPORTANT - the email field for reading is cut in size so that you only have to scroll back and forth???? The field for "received mails" can no longer be reduced far enough!!! In this way about a third of the screen is wasted with unnecessary menu bars and a no longer adjustable mail preview!!! In my eyes no progress, but rather a step backwards!!!!!!!!!!! Do something or you have lost me as a user. Or are there "hidden" settings that neutralize this bullshit???
creator: f.hellberg

title: Transfer 400k email from 3 gmail accounts to 1 new account
content:
I have setup thunderbird to transfer 3 accounts emails to one new one in thunderbird but have run into some issues. It is roughly 400k emails across all accounts.

IMAP is turned on in all the accounts. I have tried going to one accounts "All Mail" and selecting all and right clicking on that selection to copy them all to "All Mail" on the new account - I get a message that it is downloading all these emails again ( in the bottom left corner) though I don't see any emails show up in that new folder. When I try a single email copy it doesn't show up there either.

I believe I am missing some sort of functionally ( IMAP or otherwise) that belies the UX instruction to copy an email from one folder to another.

Also I tried setting up a local folder and doing the same, and no luck there either.

In some instances I was able to get maybe 100 emails to move from one all mail to another though It was me trying this over and over and sometimes the number of total email would change to the right of "all mail"

Ultimately I want to download all my email locally, copy all these local emails to the local sync path for my new email account and hopefully have those sync up to Gmail via thunderbird. Do I have this process misunderstood, are there limitations and how would this be possible through other means if what I describe is incorrect?

the new gmail is setup to have the storage needed for these emails as well.

title: OpenPGP digital signature unverified
content:
I have an external PGP key on a Yubikey that has three identities (e-mail addresses) on it.

I can send an e-mail from one of these identities to another. If I encrypt the e-mail the other mailbox will be able to decrypt it and verify the signature (of course). If I only sign the e-mail, however, the other mailbox will complain, "Invalid Digital Signature". The 'sent' folder of the sender will show the e-mail as correctly signed even when it was only signed and not encrypted.

Any ideas what is going wrong here would be gratefully received.

title: Problema TLS con Thunderbird dopo trasferimento profilo - SOLUZIONE
content:
Ho trasferito il profilo di Thunderbird da un vecchio PC con Windows 7 ad un nuovo PC con Windows 11.

Tutto OK riguardo i vari account di posta che ho regolarmente ritrovato, ma stranamento non scaricava la posta di nessuna casaella (domini aziendali, pec e gmail), con questo messaggio di errore:

"Si è verificato un errore TLS che non può essere ignorato. Si tratta di un errore di Handshake o probabilmente la versione TLS o il certificato usato dal server xxxxx non sono compatibili"

Ho trovato una risposta su questo sito che suggeriva di abbassare il livello minimo del TLS da 3 a 1 (da TLS 1.2 a TLS 1.0), ma nonostante anche un riavvio, il problema è rimasto.

Inoltre è abbastanza strano che caselle delle PEC ma anche la GMAIL utilizzino ancora un TLS vecchio e insicuro.

Ho rimesso i parametri come prima e ho creato un nuovo profilo e configurato una nuova casella di posta, inserendo i parametri corretti di imap e smpt. Compare la richiesta per l'eccezione del certificato.

OK è la mail del dominio ma sono sicuro che il certificato è valido, un semplice Let's Encrypt, ma valido. Vado a vedere il certificato... E compaiono varie informazioni di ESET, ovvero l'antivirus installato nel PC (Endpoint Security).

Ho risolto andando in Configurazione -> Protezioni -> SSL/TLS e disattivando la voce "Blocca traffico crittografato da una versione obsoleta di SSL2"

Thunderbird ha ripreso a scaricare la posta

La cosa strana è che lo stesso Antivirus è installato in moltissimi altri computer che usando Thunderbird, con quella funzione regolarmente attiva.

title: Supernova - 115 - High CPU - trashing disk
content:
I noticed that the upgrade probably triggered a re-indexation of all emails. This is causing high CPU usage AND disk activity. The process is trashing the disk with small IOs. (As seen with procmon. Lots of writes to global-message-db-sqlite and global-message-db-sqlite-journal)

This is a problem for VDI environnement and shared storage. Not everyone has its own 8 cores, 1TB superfast NVMe SSD disk.

There is room for improvement here. I think.

title: Folders disappeared - years of email archives - please help!
content:
I'm using TB 102.15.1 on Mac

I use TB for work. I have (or had) folders where I keep archives of all work-related emails for all of my clients. I had one folder for each of my clients. After I read emails in my inbox, I move them to the relevant client folder to archive them. These folders have email archives going back for several years.

Just now I was reading emails in my inbox, then moving them to folders for archival, by dragging and dropping them into the relevant client folder. I had just finished reading an email and was about to drag/drop it into a folder for archival, and the folders were gone. There was a top-level folder called "Active Projects". There were sub-folders within the "Active Projects" folder - one for each client.

Not ALL folders have disappeared. Only the Active Projects folder has disappeared.

But,... I alt-clicked on an email in my inbox to get the pop-up window with a bunch of options for things to do with the email. I could select Move To -> Recent -> and the nested window that shows recent folders pops up, and it shows the client folders and I can (apparently) move emails to the client folders. But I can't see the folders.

Please help! This is years of work history. Any suggestions for how to get the Active Project folder and all of my client sub-folders to reappear?

title: Signature Greyed Out

Can someone advise on how exactly to do make your signature not appear grey? It seems silly that this isn't a simple checkbox...
creator: nickrestiv

title: TB 115.3.1 can not filter mail to folders
content:
TB 32 bit started complaining about not being able to write to folders. After a lot of reading I discovered that there is a hard 4Gbyte limit on each account. Started moving e-mails to folders under Local Folders but the problem remained; apparently the contents of Local Folders count toward the limit. Some suggested going to the 64 bit version, alleging that it had no such hard limit, which I did, but it shows the same behavior.

This the error message that repeatedly comes up: 

"Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox."

This a single user 64 machine running Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (OS Build 19045.3448). The file system allows me to do just about anything to it, and there are currently 592 GBytes free. That's after I made a 7.1Gbyte copy of my profile folder.

Currently the offending account is a gmail account. Google says there is about 10Gbyte available. Is this something that can be fixed easily, without abandoning my admittedly large backlog of e-mail? Is there possibly some flag set in my profile that invokes the 4GByte limit?

Thanks for any insight you can provide.
creator: david.kassover

creator: bessemer

title: Deleting from Trash Folder
content:
Most of my mail comes to me via gmail, in pop3 mode. I use the portable version available on Portable Apps and I keep the program updated regularly to the latest version. My habit is to keep six months of trash stored on my hard drive. Each month, I delete the earliest month from the trash folder, then I compact the folder to recover the space. This used to be easy, but after the recent changes in the interface it has become much more difficult.

Nowadays, it has become very difficult to select several hundred early trash messages at a time. Control-down does not scroll down smoothly any more to select a large number of highlighted messages for deletion. I have to do it in very small batches. I can manage this but it is time-consuming. When I have selected a block of messages, I press the delete button, and I get the cautionary warning that the deletions will be permanent. But there is no way to answer in the affirmative. Also the "don't ask me again" box does not respond to my mouse click, even though I don't really care whether I am asked again or not. There is no way to use that little interface to actually delete the files. It's a dead end.

After some experimentation, I discovered that I can use the "move to" on the right click menu to select "move to trash" even though I really want to delete them from the trash. Then I can compact the trash folder and recover the space. So I can still accomplish the deletion in a roundabout time-consuming way.

It would be nice if TB could make that feature easier to use, or if I am doing it wrong, at least inform me of an easier way to use it.
creator: pjmorton
